DataElement.preferredDefinition: Question regarding type of lymph node procedure type.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection._Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure._Any stepwise set of actions._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Property.preferredDefinition: Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.:Any stepwise set of actions.

Concepts.definition: Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Information related to lymph node laterality and procedure type.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

PermissibleValues.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.
The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
